snippet: The Food and Drug Administration said it felt the need to act to ensure the safety of home-brew test systems that are being developed and marketed widely.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration will start regulating medical laboratory testing, move fiercely opposed by some laboratories and pathologists, who say it will increase cost and time needed to develop tests, stifling innovation and depriving patients of some critical tools; FDA will phase in the requirements over nine years and will focus on tests that involve highest level of risk to patients.
lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration said it felt the need to act to ensure the safety of home-brew test systems that are being developed and marketed widely.

headline.main: F.D.A. Acts on Lab Tests Developed In-House
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Acts on Lab Tests Developed in-House
